category: Safety and Health Management Regulations/Article 37 (Safety and Health Protective Equipment)
contents: Article 37 (Safety and Health Protective Equipment) ① The Chairman of the Board of Directors shall take necessary measures to ensure that workers are protected from harmful and hazardous work. ② If it is difficult to take the measures of Paragraph 1, the Chairman of the Board of Directors shall require workers to wear protective equipment suitable for the working environment and conditions. ③ Workers have the right and obligation to wear protective gear appropriate for the working environment and working conditions, and workers who are provided or instructed to wear protective gear by the Corporation must wear the protective gear. ④ When providing protective gear to workers, the supervisor must keep the protective gear clean so that it can be used at all times, such as by regularly inspecting it and repairing any defects or exchanging them for other ones. However, safety shoes, safety helmets, and safety goggles that workers keep clean themselves are excluded from the control of the supervisor., ⑤ If there is a risk of disease infection, the supervisor must provide workers with personal protective equipment., ⑥ Supervisor. Items that require replacement, such as dust mask filters, must be available in sufficient quantity to enable regular replacement. ⑦ Details regarding the standards for providing protective gear and the protective gear to be used for each task shall be separately determined by the chairman.
